wireless.repeater_using_tips: The entry can't be modified when repeater is enabled.
wireless.enable_dfs_tips: If router assigned with DFS channel: the channel availability check is required every time Wi-Fi is enabled, during which 5GHz signal is unavailable for connection, and this process takes $$$$; if the router detects that the radar is using the current channel, it will temporarily disconnect from the client and switch to another available channel; in addition, 5GHz Wi-Fi will be temporarily turned off while scanning for available networks nearby.
wireless.dsf_starting: Checking for channel availability，the process will take $$$$，please wait……
wireless.dsf_conflict: 5GHz Wi-Fi will be temporarily unavailable because a radar is using the channel which is currently router using.
wireless.channel_auto_dfs_tips: When your bandwidth is set to 160 MHz, Wi-Fi will always use the DFS channel, even if you choose a non-DFS channel or the "$$$$" option.
wireless.channel_auto_tips: When you select the "$$$$" option, Wi-Fi will not automatically switch to the DFS channel.
